audio_caption: The audio clip begins with the sounds of water, indicating a setting involving a body of water. A male speaker starts speaking in a calm, conversational tone, saying he's "here in the water" and pointing out his "first target" before remarking on something "screaming at me" and describes it as a "big buck". The speaker comments, "Very cool. It's most of the caption." Sounds of splashing and movement through water are mixed in.  The clip transitions to sounds of coins or change jingling, followed by the male speaker saying he has "a little bit of change that I haven't shown you."

The audio clip begins with a male speaker expressing that "digging's real hard here," implying effort in an outdoor activity. His tone sounds conversational as he mentions doing a lot on the "life big stuff" he needs to take care of. The audio includes what sounds like the whistling of a bird, or possibly an electronic bird call. The speaker then expresses mild excitement with "they're nice, oh" followed by a reflective "there we go." He then picks up a dime and mentions he also has another high tone down here and needs to find it. As he searches for this item, he begins to wonder if he has some kind of hot spot where he has found a couple coins. As he moves around, there is the sound of shoveling.

The audio begins with one male speaker indicating he has "never been out here before," followed by the sound of clanging or rattling. The speaker notes this is an "old flume area," referring to a "river part." More clanging is heard, followed by the speaker commenting that he sees what he suspects is going to be clad. Clanging sounds continue, and the speaker says, "We're starting to find some stuff." Finally, he hopes to "give you a peek."

The audio clip begins with a male speaker describing a swimming area, noting its low level and the presence of large rocks near a dock. He then states that he's trying to work with what he can, adding that things are going well so far. Immediately following this, he expresses his intent to see what else he can get. He then announces finding a quarter.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker mentioning a place where a ferry used to cross, and says he's found a lot of old coins there like "Barber quarters" and "Indian Head pennies". He speaks casually, optimistic about finding something. He then declares he's "out in the water." Throughout this speech, a water sounds persist in the background.

The audio clip features a single male speaker expressing excitement about finding a "gold ring," described as a "nice little band" that says "14k." Initially sounding somewhat discouraged, he admits to "starting to kind of give up out here," but finding the ring motivates him to "give it a little more look." These statements occur against a backdrop of consistent, natural sounds, mostly of water and other indiscernible sounds.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker stating that he sees a 26. This is accompanied by a scraping sound. The speaker then shares that the item is “probably a dime." Next he exclaims, "Look at that,” and notes that it's "in my soup but” before spotting a "penny right on top." There's also the ambient sound of water. Soon after, a single spoken word is heard: "Quarter." The speaker expresses excitement at finding a "booming 30," implying a valuable discovery. A sound of the car driving is then heard. He continues to talk, stating, "No," and also saying, "Neither one." He adds, "Look at that, car." The speaker notes that this discovery is "better than a quarter," and also "a little more fun." The clip continues with another male speaker with excitement about seeing the "30" then exclaims, "hey". There is the sound of water again. Finally, the clip ends with a man exclaiming "oh!".

The audio clip begins with a male speaker expressing excitement at finding a ring, stating "It's like I got me another ring." He then reads "Amore, love" from the ring. The speaker believes the ring is silver and expresses the need to examine a mark. The speaker then sounds happy as he states that the search is working out. Bird sounds are present in the background, suggesting an outdoor setting.

The audio clip begins with a single male speaker stating that digging in the water is a little tougher, but that there are some "nice things about it," like "there's not a lot of metal detectors out here, at least not in Montana." The speaker seems conversational and relatively calm. The clip includes ambient sounds, seemingly of outdoor origin, with low-level consistency, and there's an instance of speech identified as "I."

The audio clip begins with a male speaker saying "kind of see what's hanging." The sound of a clinking object follows. Another male voice says "nickel." Then, a male speaker expresses "All right, there we go. I got a key." The clip concludes with a rustling or shuffling sound.

The clip begins with a male voice saying, "Hey, I got a banging 30 here," followed by the sound of water. The man then continues, "Oh, I'll get it in one scoop. Alright, very good. 1980. Yeah, that's actually one of the newer coins I found in here." Another short period of water sounds is heard, and then the man says, "Okay, I'm right next to that quarter, pretty much," followed by "and I hear a 12-13," before the clip fades out. Overall, the man's tone is casual and conversational as he describes what he is finding while sifting through water.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker stating, "Well..." followed by the sound of water, suggesting a setting near or in a body of water. The speaker identifies an object, stating "See the likely a nickel," with a tone suggesting discovery or analysis. The speaker briefly pauses and then makes further remarks, "Probably dropped by the same guy... dropped the quarter." Continuing on with a sound of water, the speaker mentions, "Boulders... big rock," and says that something "might be right in my way." The speaker then discusses something about, "gold settled all the way to the bottom," and continues to search for items, describing something as "heavy" before declaring, "Oh. It is a nickel." He mentions the year, "1986," before concluding "I probably did... get dropped by the same guy."

The audio clip begins with speech, as a male speaker states "Alright, I lost my" and "lost my spot there for a second but I found it." He sounds conversational. Next, a sound is heard, described as "ringing up," followed by the speaker saying "mostly a thirty." A brief, undefined ambient sound is noted. The speaker then remarks, "Looks like we got tricked by the VDA that time just a penny." This is immediately succeeded by a dramatic musical piece, like a suspenseful movie soundtrack, creating a tense atmosphere, which takes over the remaining part of the clip.
